descendants.content:
@cosmiclibrarian

My parents were of the age when Little House on the Prairie was a Great American Epic. My dad would talk about "carving it out of the wilderness." I didn't even bother to discuss with them my resolution, in 1970, that I was never going to own a car. (Climate change was still some years of in being discussed explicitly in those terms in the popular press. But the direction society was headed was clear.)

Avi: blue & red Yin/Yang symbol, transected by black & white question marks, the dot of each centered in the loop of the other. Profile img: colorful sculpture like what an spider might weave if she could do embroidery, & was on an acid trip.

descendants.content:
@cosmiclibrarian
Gee, am I the only person who remembers an organized, relentless effort by industrialists/Republicans to call any measurable change in climate data both “natural periodic fluctuations” and a HOAX?

Americans don’t have selective amnesia — reason has been trampled by profiteers’ lies.

Greed is killing the Earth.

#ClimateCrisis

descendants.content:
@cosmiclibrarian

In 1972 the Club or Rome published its
"The Limits to Growth"

"The message of this book still holds today: The earth’s interlocking resources – the global system of nature in which we all live – probably cannot support present rates of economic and population growth much beyond the year 2100, if that long, even with advanced technology."

And still here we are...

https://www.clubofrome.org/publication/the-limits-to-growth/

account.note: “Learn from the mistakes of others. You can never live long enough to make them all yourself.”― Groucho Marx
